6:T4c9,A technology leader with nearly 8 years of experience in <code >full-stack</code> development, <code >cloud platforms</code>, and <code >distributed systems</code>. Specialized in building scalable, high-performance applications using modern technologies. Passionate on learing, mentoring teams, enforcing best practices, and optimizing software efficiency, scalability, and business growth.

I have been actively learning software development since 2014 and started my career as a software developer in 2017. I possess a deep understanding of <code >software development processes</code>, <code >different environments</code>, <code >tools</code>, <code >protocols</code>, <code >networking</code>, <code >data structures</code>, <code >OOP concepts</code>, and <code >design patterns</code>. With a strong foundation in computer science and mathematics, I have hands-on experience in application development, architecture, cloud platforms, distributed system design, big data, and delivering highly <code >scalable</code> applications.

I am a self-motivated, self-taught problem solver, always eager to learn new technologies. My adaptability allows me to work with any tech stack and quickly grasp emerging technologies.

3.188 1.244-.785 2.898.06 2.883 1.394.595-.016.223-.744.115-1.215-.353-1.528.592-3.187.041-4.59-1.064.084-1.939.52-2.578 1.215zm9.12 1.113c.307.562.404 1.148.84 1.57.195.19.574.424.387.95-.045.121-.365.391-.551.45-.674.195-2.254.03-1.721-.81.563.015 1.314.36 1.732-.045-.314-.524-.885-1.53-.674-2.13zm6.198-.013h.068c.33.668.6 1.375 1.004 1.965-.27.628-2.053 1.19-2.023.057.39-.17 1.05-.035 1.395-.25-.193-.556-.48-1.006-.434-1.771zm-6.927-1.617c-1.422-.33-2.131.592-2.56 1.553-.384-.094-.231-.615-.135-.883.255-.701 1.28-1.633 2.119-1.506.359.057.848.386.576.834zM9.642 1.593c-1.56.44-3.56 1.574-4.2 2.974.495-.07.84-.321 1.33-.351.186-.016.428.074.641.015.424-.104.78-1.065 1.102-1.41.31-.345.685-.496.94-.81.167-.09.409-.074.42-.33-.073-.075-.15-.135-.232-.105v.017ze:T42b,Moved to Serialization Product vertical, it was BaaS (Edge Software) product very curial service for Product serialization.  It has to sync with Cloud data and have to communicated with Industrial printers. It offers multiple services based on client subscription. It was very Stright forward each feature developed as individual service. Eventually O4S started to provide multiple integration and features it becomes multiple micro services. It also becomes hard to develop unified design and business logic. So we started to identify different layers involved in flow then abstracted, implemented shared middleware, Job Creations Flow assigned responsibility to each component in a hierarchy. Even created shared utility library for **"Shared Business Logic"** or **"Domain Service".** I was primarily assigned to modularize this shared Business logic to use as dependency library. We started to convert micro service architecture to kind of monolithic architecture. Because this is not a distributed or cloud service. Edge (BaaS) is kind of separate software suit.f:T6ba,Note: We are using unicode character (UTF-8), Where can use a Private Use Area (PUA) codes only. which only support range of 6,400 code points. Due to this imitation we can't define all or large webfont icon together. And creating Icon font from svg have to do some preparations. So we have create svg library so that we can have any number of icons even svg files and it follows design guidance of framework so that icons also in sync with theme. Why I was choosed to create new framework and started from scratch, because old framework was directly built on old versions of frameworks and used lot of open source code which is very hard to migrate. And gave complete contol to each developer to attain the goal so each followed their own design guides which not compatible to manage lot of mix-in makes things worst, So I started to follow Strangler Fig pattern, incrementally started to develop features on new framework. It ended in great value especially for developers because there was no mess-up like configurations everything was provided as predefined components. Especially developer was happy it reduced their effort almost 70%. In a result very few bugs almost (90%) improvement. FE timeline was always shorter than BE timeline. QA is the only person who disappointed because they couldnâ€™t comeup with design like bugs. Which is the major count in QA eariler. On top of that Single place of control, No other open-source components, new latest framework was adapted like vue 3, Pinia state management and Library can be shared across multiple product and company wise UI design follows same design pattern. We also provided business component so that they can plug and play component by just passing props. Tools"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"children":["$","div",null,{"className":"!text-secondary-600 prose max-w-none ozi-format","children":[["$","p","0",{"dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":""}}],["$","ul","ul-2541",{"children":[["$","li","1",{"children":"Joined as Software Engineer - Backend then transitioned into Senior Software Engineer - Full stack where I started to work on with Eagle Product vertical, Its control / admin panel for O4S to control operations across product vertical. Which is run behind VPN and used Firebase authentication with separate eagle access control management. It offers company onboarding, manage company configurations, manufacturing facilities, users and so on. We do maintain some batch script to create and organize data to ensure business critical data was readily available for continually running businesses. So there was tight dependency on developer to manage data and this will be crucial for business operations. So I was given a task to organize this in better way by exposing APIâ€™s and developing FE screens called as `Ops Lab` to give direct control to operations team to handle request by theme self."}],["$","li","2",{"children":"$e"}],["$","li","3",{"children":"In BaaS, we stay at forefront to address all production issues with Product serialization on Industrial Printers ensure higher uptime without stopping any productions. It was a one great exposure for me to know about How automated industries are works. It also gave me an platform to learn about Industrial printer because it is not a like computers, it has to communicated with physical world and has so many dependency on other factors and then printer have it own protocols, but I was specifically aware bit about Zipher Text Communications Protocol. It was intriguing to delve deep into this but I couldnâ€™t go beyond certain range because the middleware was already developed and does all necessary stuff. In most of the time it was all about wrong configuration, like buffer issue, retry-delay, buffer-delay, printer not responsive, Wrong IP/Port configurations, wrong file directory setup. connection hangup due to some unknow activity, reset, retry, and so, it was command based communication."}],["$","li","4",{"children":"In Edge, We Introduced formScheme, InfoTable, CSN (Custom Serial Number) features to support Customized or personalized product serialization mechanism. From then I was started to led teams by mentoring them"}],["$","li","5",{"children":"At edge, I was worked with extensive network communication protocols starting from REST API communication with cloud, gRPC, Websockets, Https servers Human Interface Device (HID, like serial port scanners) along with Simple in-memory queue called better-queue for job management, pkg to create package, NSSM to manage windows services,"}],["$","li","6",{"children":"We implemented Order Manager for seems integration with ERP with external system to manage life cycle of Product supply chain. Order manager has four primary features namely Production Order (Order can be created directly from dashbaord or External ERP System), Dispatch Order (Once order was processed it can be dispatched to some were else), Receive Order, Return Order. Multiple options product serialization in order management"}],["$","li","7",{"children":"At the time or redesigning our System design stack, I picked FE stack to come up with o4s own FE framework where design all is controlled by UI library itself, we have to provide UI component  that can be composable only based on business logic. Main idea is, developing a FE screen FE developer should not spent time on configuring routes, constantly checking figma to ensure all color codes, font typographic, they just only have focus on building business logical blocks rest like color, design, layout, API controller are managed by Library Controller and theme provider. On top of that we also introduced Icon font library using company specific set of icons."}]]}],["$","p","8",{"dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"    "}}],["$","ul","ul-7983",{"children":[["$","li","9",{"children":"$f"}]]}],["$","p","10",{"dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"    "}}],["$","ul","ul-3555",{"children":[["$","li","11",{"children":"I recommended team to change tech stack for FE products, earlier we used traditional app based deployment which uses nginx to serve FE build. Then I choose to go with s3 and CloudFront based deployment for multi app delivery."}],["$","li","12",{"children":"I led the team to migrated very critical feature of product, which is Scheme Management, along with new features like Version control management and Log management for changes. Initially I proposed new design which uses multiple collection to control data flow. But we do have constraints with time and resources, making changes on this data model may impact large chain of services. So I was suggested to come up with existing data model allowed me to do add extra field to control Lifecyle.  Then I purposed the way to use existing data model which doesnâ€™t affect any flow and successfully implemented version control along with approver, rejector user role to manage different life cycle of data."}],["$","li","13",{"children":"At O4S, Reward payment implemented tightly coupled with Reward/Incentive provider, So business logic with had dependency on them, Interesting part every service provider has it won way of data management, Initially doesnâ€™t have much impact when company grows we have to support lot of providers across different country, due to strong composition of data and logic provider it make harder to maintain expand capacity so I was assigned this task to decouple providers, So we came up with O4S based reward parameter which unifies Reward behavior and o4s has more control over Reward Management like Point calculations, Money conversion, Min and Max rewards, Multiplier, Ratios, Percentage on values. Which was used entire lifecycle of redemption. It was transfer to appropriate service provider model at the time of User claim request only."}],["$","li","14",{"children":"One fine day, we received one Fire issue, where user not able to claim points. When I checked the code, I found few issues. First is we used cache where dataset was large in which large portion arenâ€™t really helpful in most cases like overusing cache anyway this may not be the real RCA,  At code it was maintained as product cluster which is primarily used only in this logic when I debug this there was long call to front and forth and it reached almost 16MB size of single document restriction in mongoDB due to large product cluster. For this specific use case I found out that we can directly do better calculation maintaining Flat data by vertically at one separate collection along with earning criteria data and having sufficient dB index will help us to solve the problem and also reduce Cold cache issues as well. By changing this reduced latency and improved response time by almost 75% and removed cluster concept."}],["$","li","15",{"children":"Implemented RBAC flow by redefining scope of access control for entire app for Both BE and FE, initially it was handled by Uncontrolled or loosely coupled role, permission and user map associations. Which leads to ambiguity in terms of grant and revoke features access to users or group of users. So, we created direct permissions associated features and maintained in flat hierarchy so whenever there was an new feature just has to add feature permission entry on DB rest will be take care by flows.  Now users, Permission features association are direct managed in role management flow. And provided multiple control panel to manage RBAC."}],["$","li","16",{"children":"Visibility Group feature development, which is the project used to create custom filters on Reporting project to allow dashboard user to view particular set of data instead allowing user to view all company data and allows user to get better insights across regional clusters."}],["$","li","17",{"children":"Worked with Edge VAPT certification process specifically implementing Unified login Flow"}],["$","li","18",{"children":"In order to customize business data attribute on user onboard and provide personalize user experience we developed custom-properties service by which company can control what are the information need to process like PAN, Aadhar Card, other certification this could be different for different companies, on top of the company can control Form field creation, form visibility to the user allows personalization at some level."}],["$","li","19",{"children":"Worked with lot of tools like Teleport, K8s Lens, Telepresence, Simulators, Prefect, Jenkins, Kafka, Mongo Source connectors, Postman, insomnia, and more."}],["$","li","20",{"children":"As a full-stack developer, always be a person to point out issues and suggest solutions to a lot of scenarios. did feasibility analysis on migrations and feature expansions, very strict on creating and maintaining data models on the system and how to keep things at scale even though there was no requirement from the product team."}],["$","li","21",{"children":"Regularly conducting code reviews for peers, providing product feature demos to stakeholders, and effectively guiding the QA team to focus on impacted areas. Actively supporting team members by offering suggestions and assistance whenever needed"}],["$","li","22",{"children":"Whatever was developed, everything discussed with Engineering VP based on timeline, cost, resource availability we always go with tradeoff strategy to achieve business goals."}]]}],["$","p","23",{"dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":" 16:[["$","title","0",{"children":"Maheshwaran G"}],["$","meta","1",{"name":"description","content":"Maheshwaran G Portfolio site"}],["$","link","2",{"rel":"icon","href":"/favicon.ico","type":"image/x-icon","sizes":"16x16"}]]
